      • grant

        void grant(java.lang.String perm,
           java.lang.String schema,
           java.lang.String table,
           java.lang.String user)
    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Grant a single permission to a single user. Utility method that takes a single string for user instead of an array of Strings.
        Parameters:
        perm - Permission to grant
        schema - Schema on which to grant permission
        table - Table on which to grant permission
        user - User to grant permission to
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws all exceptions
        java.sql.SQLException

        table - Table on which to grant permission
        user - User to grant permission to

        void grant(java.lang.String perm,
           java.lang.String schema,
           java.lang.String table,
           java.lang.String[] users)
    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Grant a SQL permission to a set of users.
        Parameters:
        perm - The permission to grant
        schema - the schema on which to grant the permission
        table - the table on which to grant the permission
        users - an Array of users to grant the permission
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws all exceptions
        java.sql.SQLException

      • grant

        void grant(java.sql.Connection c,
           java.lang.String perm,
           java.lang.String schema,
           java.lang.String table,
           java.lang.String user)
    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Grant a single permission to a single user for a given connection. Callers of this method should ensure that they close the Connection that is passed in. Used primarily in rollback tests where we want to ensure the grant/revoke statements are being called by the database owner.
        Parameters:
        c - the Connection used to execute the grant statement
        perm - Permission to grant
        schema - Schema on which to grant permission
        table - Table on which to grant permission
        user - User to grant permission to
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws all exceptions
        java.sql.SQLException

            java.lang.String table,
            java.lang.String user)
     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Revoke a single permission from a single user. Utility method that takes a single string for user instead of an array of Strings.
        Parameters:
        perm - Permission to revoke
        schema - Schema on which to revoke permission
        table - Table on which to revoke permission
        user - User to revoke permissions
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws all exceptions
        java.sql.SQLException

            java.lang.String schema,
            java.lang.String table,
            java.lang.String[] users)
     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Revoke a SQL permission from a set of users.
        Parameters:
        perm - The permission to revoke
        schema - the schema on which to revoke the permission
        table - the table on which to revoke the permission
        users - an array of users to revoke the permission

      • revoke

        void revoke(java.sql.Connection c,
            java.lang.String perm,
            java.lang.String schema,
            java.lang.String table,
            java.lang.String user)
     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Revoke a single permission to a single user for a given connection. Callers of this method should ensure that they close the Connection that is passed in. Used primarily in rollback tests where we want to ensure the grant/revoke statements are being called by the database owner.
        Parameters:
        c - the connection to execute the revoke statement
        perm - Permission to revoke
        schema - Schema on which to revoke permission
        table - Table on which to revoke permission
        user - User to revoke permission
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws all exceptions
        java.sql.SQLException

                                java.lang.String[] columns)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Assert all privileges for a given user / schema / table / column set
        Parameters:
        hasPrivilege - whether we expect the given user to have the privilege
        user - the user to check
        schema - the schema to check
        table - the table to check
        columns - the set of columns to check for the user

        java.sql.SQLException

      • assertFunctionPrivilege

        public void assertFunctionPrivilege(boolean hasPrivilege,
                                    java.lang.String user,
                                    java.lang.String schema,
                                    java.lang.String function,
                                    boolean forProcedure)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Assert that a user has function execute privilege on a given table / column
        Parameters:
        hasPrivilege - whether or not the user has the privilege
        user - the user to check
        schema - the schema to check
        function - the function to check
        forProcedure - true if checking for lack of function execute privilege against procedure of same name.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - throws all exceptions

      • assertProcedurePrivilege

        public void assertProcedurePrivilege(boolean hasPrivilege,
                                     java.lang.String user,
                                     java.lang.String schema,
                                     java.lang.String procedure)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Assert that a user has procedure execute privilege on a given table / column
        Parameters:
        hasPrivilege - whether or not the user has the privilege
        user - the user to check
        schema - the schema to check
        procedure - the name of the procedure to check
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - throws all exceptions

      • assertPrivilegeMetadata

        public void assertPrivilegeMetadata(boolean hasPrivilege,
                                    java.lang.String type,
                                    java.lang.String user,
                                    java.lang.String schema,
                                    java.lang.String table,
                                    java.lang.String[] columns)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Assert that a specific privilege exists by checking the database metadata available to a user
        Parameters:
        hasPrivilege - true if we expect the caller to have the privilege
        type - type of privilege, e.g. SELECT, INSERT, DELETE, etc.
        user - the user to check
        schema - the schema to check
        table - the table to check
        columns - the set of columns to check, or all columns if null
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

                              int type)
        Append a particular SQL datatype value to the given StringBuffer
        Parameters:
        sb - the StringBuffer to append the value
        type - the java.sql.Types value to append

      • getColumnDataType

        java.lang.String getColumnDataType(java.lang.String schema,
                                   java.lang.String table,
                                   java.lang.String column)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Given a schema, table, and column as Strings, return the datatype of the column as a String.
        Parameters:
        schema - the schema for the table in which the column resides
        table - the table containing the column to check
        column - the column to get the data type as a String
        Returns:
        the Type of the column as a String
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
